@MirrorPolitics The only banknotes recognised by the ECB as legal tender are euro banknotes issued by the Eurosystem. The production of this 'souvenir' note is not regulated or approved by the ECB. Souvenir notes must comply with ECB reproduction rules so that they cannot be mistaken as genuine.

If you want to know more about the current and future prospects of card payments in Europe, read the latest report from the ECB’s Market Infrastructure and Payments Committee 4/4 https://t.co/zcONf4UNpW

For you to always be able to use your national bank card anywhere in Europe, both tech innovation and a strong European card payments market will be crucial. We work to encourage these by monitoring market developments and supporting cooperation in the industry 3/4

Despite the rising popularity of payment cards, there may be times when it’s not possible for you to use your card wherever you go in Europe. This is because there isn't yet a comprehensive European solution that enables all European cards to be used in any EU country 2/4

(THREAD) After cash, card was the most common payment method in the EU in 2017, and the number of card payments per person rose in every single EU country between 2014 and 2017. This makes card the fastest growing method of electronic payment in Europe 1/4 https://t.co/ORf3JqEBHP
Card payments in Europe – current landscape and future prospects: a Eurosystem perspective https://t.co/V6ZDKlefzx

While the promotion gap is closing, there is a lot more to do. For example, women are still less likely to apply for a promotion and they are still underrepresented in top positions. Read the latest ECB working paper for more https://t.co/mxei0ZO3OD  3/3

We are heartened by the initiative to restore and rebuild this landmark. The ECB will make a financial contribution to the restoration #NotreDameCathedralFire

The ECB stands in solidarity with people in France and globally after fire damaged Notre-Dame cathedral, a world heritage site. European history and culture remind us of our shared values #NotreDameCathedralFire https://t.co/kLpE6NwGv6
Nous nous félicitons de l’initiative qui a été prise de reconstruire ce magnifique édifice. La BCE participera aux efforts de restauration #NotreDame

La BCE exprime sa solidarité envers le peuple français, suite à l’incendie qui a ravagé la cathédrale Notre-Dame, un monument du patrimoine mondial, de la culture européenne, cher au cœur des Français #NotreDame https://t.co/YKD2LeqRfG

Watch again: Draghi on how the ECB’s monetary policy affects people and businesses https://t.co/IUcWEFAQBP
Watch again: Draghi on how effective the ECB’s monetary policy has been https://t.co/YDuoMoj1pX
Watch again: Draghi on the ECB’s 2% inflation target https://t.co/1mTxSXpuEg
Watch again: Draghi on how protectionism affects the euro area and worldwide growth https://t.co/P3g3FJxoHN
Watch again: Draghi on how the Governing Council assesses the inflation outlook https://t.co/8aJxpY0arq
Watch again: Draghi on the probability of another economic recession https://t.co/Fwy74pDXUw
Watch again: Draghi on why Europeans are stronger together https://t.co/EzMrlR3NY9
Letter Andrea Enria, Chair of the Supervisory Board, to Mr Chountis, MEP, on loan origination standards https://t.co/wG7USrZ06D (EN) https://t.co/0nRpXAHgj5 (EL)
Draghi: I would like to express my deepest thanks to Peter Praet as today was his last monetary policy meeting before his term ends
Draghi: We are confident that inflation will converge toward our objective, if we were to raise rates we would be less confident
Draghi: The role of supervisors in a merger is to make sure that the transaction is successful, which means that it creates an entity that is strong and capable of coping with various challenges
Draghi: Priority for Italy is to restore growth and employment and Italy knows how to do it
Draghi: Central banks don’t usually intervene in the political debate. On occasion the ECB can defend the European framework and point out ways to complete it and remedy weaknesses.
Draghi: Inflation can deviate from our inflation objective as long as the sustainable path converges to our medium term aim
Draghi: We wish to have much more cross-border lending
Draghi: Today's meeting was one where the main goal was to reassert the readiness to act if the contingency warranted, so it was not an operational meeting
Draghi: The estimated probabilities of a recession remain low

Draghi: We are in the process of carrying out an analysis how banks' profitability is being affected by the negative deposit rate.  Banks are differently affected by it depending on their business model.
Introductory statement Mario Draghi to the press conference https://t.co/EXen5SQL69
Draghi: Our inflation aim does not imply a ceiling at 2%
Draghi: We remain fully committed to return inflation to 2% without any undue delay
Draghi: Markets have fully understood our reaction function
Draghi: All countries should reinforce their efforts to achieve a more growth-friendly composition of public finances

Draghi: In order to reap the full benefits from our monetary policy measures, other policy areas must contribute more decisively to raising the longer-term growth potential and reducing vulnerabilities

Draghi: Our monetary policy measures, including the new series of TLTROs, will help to safeguard favourable bank lending conditions and will continue to support access to financing, in particular for small and medium-sized enterprises

Draghi: The risks surrounding the euro area growth outlook remain tilted to the downside, on account of the persistence of uncertainties related to geopolitical factors, the threat of protectionism and vulnerabilities in emerging markets

Draghi: However, an ample degree of monetary accommodation remains necessary to safeguard favourable financing conditions and support the economic expansion, and to ensure that inflation remains on a sustained path towards levels below, but close to, 2% over the medium term
Draghi: Further employment gains and rising wages continue to underpin the resilience of the domestic economy and gradually rising inflation pressures

Draghi: In the context of our regular assessment, we will also consider whether the preservation of the favourable implications of negative interest rates for the economy requires the mitigation of their possible side effects, if any, on bank intermediation

Draghi: The pricing of the new TLTRO-III operations will take into account a thorough assessment of the bank-based transmission channel of monetary policy, as well as further developments in the economic outlook
Draghi: Details on the precise terms of the new series of quarterly targeted longer-term refinancing operations (TLTROs) will be communicated at one of our forthcoming meetings

Draghi: The Governing Council stands ready to adjust all of its instruments, as appropriate, to ensure that inflation continues to move towards the Governing Council’s inflation aim in a sustained manner

Draghi: We intend to continue reinvesting, in full, the principal payments from maturing securities purchased under the APP for an extended period of time past the date when we start raising the key ECB interest rates, and in any case for as long as necessary

Draghi: We continue to expect the key interest rates to remain at their present levels at least through the end of 2019, and in any case for as long as necessary to ensure the continued sustained convergence of inflation to our objective
